data.title: [MD Addin] Fix Pipeline Tool command for Linux
Improve and simplify Joystick and GamePad detection
data.body:
Notes:
- Instead of trying to use instanceid/deviceid, now we are using our own ids
  - when device gets added we just use the first empty slot
  - when device gets removed we search the dictionary and remove the device with specified instanceid once found
- GameControllerAdded event cannot be used since it doesn't always get triggered, so JoystickAdded event is used for GamePad
- Fixes: #4948 

CC. @mrhelmut @endimilojkoski

data.title: Support FBX embedded textures
data.body:
Inspired by [this](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/38059810/mongame-content-pipeline-compile-fbx-with-embedded-texture-to-xnb/38071762) Stack Overflow thread. XNA supported embedded textures, if I remember correctly.

Assimp introduced support for this in Assimp/Assimp#694, and our version is significantly older. It would also require some logic changes to `OpenAssetImporter`.

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Make PropertyGrid Extendable
data.body:
Custom cells for propertygrid can now be added from a dll that is referenced in a project, I'll write some documentation on this later on.

Also fixes #4946 and #4947

data.title: Fix preprocessor directive bug
data.body: I think this preprocessor directive is misspelled. I wasn't getting input and buttons weren't displayed in my wp8.1 project because of it.

data.body: Use a Premultiply color in SpriteBatch test.

data.title: properly apply tint color to RBG channels
data.body: Small fix to the SpriteEffect shader that multiplies the texture.rgb by the vertex color alpha

data.title: Added initial XAct support for RPC curves and some unit tests
data.body:
This is the start of refactors to Xact to make more correct to XNA.  The major changes in this one:
- Initial support for RPC curves.
- Started the correct path for Xact 3D support.
- Fixed up missing exceptions on method arguments.
- Moved a bunch of nested types to their own files.
- Added some initial unit tests.

As part of some of the changes some tabs to spaces were changed, so use this link to see the actual differences:

  https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/4961/files?w=0

data.title: Stencil buffer is not working with OpenGL on NVIDIA graphics cards.
data.body:
I've asked a question on MonoGame community forum and i was sent here to report an issue - http://community.monogame.net/t/opengl-stencil-buffer-problem-on-nvidia-graphics-card/7811

I tried to use stencil buffer in my game to do alpha masking. I followed this tutorial: https://medium.com/@sfranks/i-originally-wrote-this-for-the-best-way-to-mask-2d-sprites-in-xna-game-development-stack-949cf7bd7421#.wji9zxbjd

Using MonoGame Cross Platform Desktop Project (OpenGL) it worked only when I'm using integrated Intel's graphics card (Intel HD Graphics 5500).
When I tried to run it on NVIDIA card (tested with GeForce 940M, GeForce 220M and GeForce 7300GT) the whole image is displaying instead of masked parts.

On MonoGame Windows Project (DirectX) it works okay on Intel's card as well as on NVIDIA card.

I don't have an ATI card to check it on it.

Additionally, I've build an Android project and here it was working okay. (Samsung Galaxy Mini 2 - GT-S6500, Gingerbread 2.3.6, GPU Adreno 200 enhanced).

Source code used to test: http://pastebin.com/9zkUCiPt
Full Visual Studio solutions with OpenGL, DirectX and Android projects: https://www.dropbox.com/s/ivaz58j8omhd3nw/stenciltest.zip?dl=1

Screenshot of valid result: http://i.imgur.com/mryF0W8.png
Invalid: http://i.imgur.com/eswi8N8.png

data.title: Fixed DirectX backbuffer resize behaviour
data.body:
Also added an if statement to stop the infinite recursion issue I found in WinFormsGameWindow.cs (directly related to backbuffer problem)

I don't think this will cause more issues, but please let me know if it does.

Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/4922
Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/4018
Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/4841

data.title: Update SDL Platform to Enable/Disable Screensaver of it loose/gain focus.
data.body:
We really shouldn't be Disabling the screen saver completely.
If the user switches to another app the screen saver should be
re-enabled. As a result we also need to make sure we re-disable
it if we get focus again.

Additionally we need to make sure the Cursor is set because sometimes
on MacOS it looses the setting when switching windows

data.body:
Hi there,

**Sorry, wrong GitHub repo.**

Cheers.

data.title: Fixed static VBs and IBs on UWP on XB1

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
Looks like we've been incorrectly been setting the `DataBox` when setting the static VB/IB data on DirectX platforms.  If you look at the DirectX docs...

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476486(v=vs.85).aspx

We were setting 1 as the `SrcRowPitch` as defined in `DataBox` as SharpDX.  This technically means the pitch of the data being set is 1 byte... much less than the actual length of the source data.  On all our previous DirectX platforms... desktop, Windows Phone, Windows 8, and Windows 10 UWP on desktops and even Raspberry Pi 2...  this was allowed and things worked correctly.

On the new XB1 platform setting 1 for `SrcRowPitch` results in the `UpdateSubresource` call to silently fail to copy the data to the buffer.

This is our bug technically, but it is a difference in the implementation of DX in a UWP app on XB1.

Thanks to @walbourn for suggesting the change which lead me to spot this bug.

Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/4829

data.title: SDL Controller DB update
data.body: This is an update to the SDL controllers database to support more gamepads. Changes come from upstream (https://github.com/gabomdq/SDL_GameControllerDB).

data.title: WinDX: Fixed crash when running from a network path
data.body:
I got a crash report telling me that the `WinFormsGameWindow` constructor had thrown an `ArgumentException` when calling `Icon.ExtractAssociatedIcon`. After some investigation, I found that this same crash would occur when running my game from a UNC network path.

According to the [MSDN documenation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.drawing.icon.extractassociatedicon%28v=vs.110%29.aspx), `Icon.ExtractAssociatedIcon` does not support UNC paths (it doesn't say why though). I found a couple of stackoverflow posts<sup>[[1](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6819466/extractassociatedicon-returns-null)][[2](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1842226/how-to-get-the-associated-icon-from-a-network-share-file)]</sup> suggesting to use P/Invoke to get around this. So I gave this a try and found that it did indeed work correctly for both UNC and normal file paths.

This PR uses this solution to fix the crash which would occur when running from a UNC network path.

data.title: Fix importing of skeleton which is not a direct child of root node
data.body:
Before this fix, model with a skeleton which isn't direct child of
root node would become a direct child of root node which messed up some
animations.

In my case skeleton was a child of a mesh which was animated so it impacted the whole skeleton. Assimp model viewer supports that kind of animation so I think it would make sense for MonoGame too.

data.title: Content build action ignoring .mgcb output path settings
data.body:
When building a monogame project from VS2015 (on windows 7, anyway), your build files and finished .xnb's etc. get dropped into a hokey default _'Content'_ and _'bin/(whatever platform)_ folder, rather than what you specified in the actual .mgcb file.

Building from the pipeline GUI or command line however, works as expected, putting your files where you tell it to.

Not that much of an issue if you never play with the default path settings, but if you don't want your game's resource folder to be hard-coded as _'Content'_ it gets troublesome.

data.title: Proofing haptic init
data.body:
Despite #4937 &  #4928 ( -_-' ), there are still possible errors with the haptic initialization which may result in crashes (mostly with Logitech F710 & F310 gamepads, or X360 controllers with non-official drivers).

This PR hopefully bullet-proof the whole thing.

I can't be sure, but I suspect that errors are not cleared and re-thrown outside the try/catch upon new `Sdl.Haptic.OpenFromJoystick` or `Sdl.Haptic.EffectSupported`. Hence, I removed internal calls to `Sdl.GetError()` to avoid exceptions and handle the errors manually.

@dellis1972 This may be linked to the errors you may have encountered on Linux.

data.title: GamePad issues
data.body:
1. Connecting X360 Gamepad while game is running the game crashes. It tries to add deviceId=0 key which already exist and I have only 1 gamepad connected.
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13436441/16155581/5054cae6-34b0-11e6-8f86-0ba0b505bd23.png)
2. When starting the game with 1 X360 and 2 generic gamepads the game starts fine and the X360 gamepad works but the 2 generic ones are not recognised.
   In this scenario I see 2 GamePads and 4 Joysticks, each have +1 unknown device. So GamePad gets only the X360 and Joystick get all gamepads connected. This is where they are assigned:
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13436441/16155687/c960f00e-34b0-11e6-801c-6b95f7fa36fd.png)
3. On my old MacBook the X360 gamepad works fine if connected before starting the game but for a friend of mine with newer MacBook the game crashes if his X360 gamepad is connected. This is already reported in issue #4932 

In 3.5 gamepads were working great through GamePad. All were recognised and I could plug them while in game and they would work with no issues.

@cra0zy @mrhelmut

data.title: (PipelineTool) Single click on current property value does not start editing.
data.body: Double-click seems to be required before you can start editing the value of a property. This is quite odd and non-standard property grid behavior.

data.title: PipelineTool's left-side tool panel too narrow default value
data.body: I have to adjust the size of the left tool panel and/or the name/value splitter within the propertygrid every single time i launch the pipeline tool in order to have a usable amount of space to work with the value-column.

data.title: Make TitleContainer resolve resource paths on Windows
data.body:
This is the new version of https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/4132 that splits its TitleContainer code into platform specific files.

When you call the TitleContainer.OpenStream method on Windows platforms, it needs to lookup the location of the specified resource. This is because on Windows 10, resources may be stored outside of the main application folder when using an "application bundle" (now the default setting). 

This solves a problem that we had in production where our game would work fine when deploying from within Visual Studio, but it wouldn't be able to find its localized resources when bundled and deployed via a package. With this PR, localized resources are looked up using the standard Windows APIs and everything works great.

This API is available for Windows8, WindowsPhone81, and WindowsUniversal but not for WindowsPhone (8.0), so the TitleContainer was split appropriately to prevent too many #ifs.

data.title: Returns proper screen size in UAP
data.body: This change delivers the current desktop screen size for windows universal projects (WINDOWS_UAP)
